nodes.name: Append row in sheet in Google Sheets
Append row in sheet in Google Sheets7
Extract Columbus Foundation Beyond Backyard Grants1

options.systemMessage:
You are given scraped webpage content which includes one or more tender/project listings. Your task is to extract the following fields from each listing:

- Name of Org
- Project Name
- Description
- Open Bid Date
- Bid Deadline
- Contact Name
- Contact Phone
- Contact Email
- Links
- Current Available Grant 
- Draft Email (compose a polite, professional message expressing interest or requesting details)

For each listing found, call the tool named **Append row in sheet in Google Sheets** with the correct values for these fields.

Make one tool call per listing. If there are multiple listings, call the tool multiple times, once per listing.

If a value is missing, pass an empty string. Do **not** skip entries with missing fields.

Check the column in Google sheet Current Available Grant = Yes send the message in Gmail.

Ensure that emails already sent are not resent. Everything else should continue working as it is.

Do not repeat emails for the same Grant Availability.

Do not return anything else. Only use the tool to append each structured row to the Google Sheet.

parameters.subject: Current Available Grant
parameters.message: =Hello there is a new grant available for{{ $json['Project Name'] }} by {{ $json['Name of Org'] }} available with a deadline to bid by {{ $json['Bid Deadline'] }}. Here is a link to the website {{ $('614Beautiful2').item.json.data.metadata.sourceURL }} and here is the description: {{ $('614Beautiful2').item.json.data.metadata['og:description'] }}.
